      • compare

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> compare(Matrix m)
        compare two matrix
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to compare with the main matrix
        Returns:
        a list of boolean errors thar are : 0 - matrix null 1 - Col1 == Col2 2 - Row1 == Row2 3 - Col1 == Row2 4 - Row1 == Col2

      • compare

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> compare(Matrix m,
                                                 java.lang.String numErr)
        the same that the first compare the change here is that we can specify which error to check with "numErr" Exemple : compare(m1,"12") it will check if (Col1 == Col2 and Row1 == Row2 )
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to compare with the main matrix
        numErr - it's a string wich specify wich error to check from 0 to 4
        Returns:
        a list of boolean

      • getError

        public java.lang.String getError(Matrix m)
        Use method compare to print errors
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to compare with the main matrix
        Returns:
        a string of errors

      • operation

        public static Matrix operation(Matrix m1,
                               Matrix m2,
                               char op)
        do add (if op=='+') or sub (if op=='-') for 2 matrix
        Parameters:
        m1 - matrix 1
        m2 - matrix 2
        op - the type of operation + or -
        Returns:
        matrix = (m1 op m2)

      • sum

        private static double sum(Matrix m1,
                          Matrix m2,
                          int row,
                          int col)
        it sum the col of matrix 1 with the row of matrix 2 (it's used in the multiplication method)
        Parameters:
        m1 - matrix 1
        m2 - matrix 2
        row - the row of matrix 1
        col - the col of matrix 2
        Returns:
        the sum

      • switchLine

        private void switchLine(int rowA,
                        int rowB)
        switch between two line's
        Parameters:
        rowA - the first line (line 2 become line 1)
        rowB - the second line (line 1 become line 2)

      • reflect

        public Matrix reflect()
        it exchange elem(i,j) with elem(MaxRow-i-1,MinRow-j-1) (it's user for the methods lowerEchelonner() and echelonnerReduced() )
        Returns:
        a matrix

      • rank

        public int rank()
        Give the rank of a matrix it's use the echelonne form to find the rank
